bcl:definition.bcl:text: applicant means a person applying for a letter of permission under section 35Â [issuance of letter of permission] of the Act;
prospective employer means a board of education or an independent school authority that is considering becoming the employer of an applicant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant must apply for a letter of permission in the form and manner required by the director of certification.
An application may be jointly completed by an applicant and a prospective employer.

The director of certification may request the following information from a prospective employer, whether or not the application is made by the applicant or jointly by the applicant and the prospective employer:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: made reasonable efforts to hire a certificate holder for the position for which the applicant is being considered, and
was unable to recruit a certificate holder for the position;
confirmation that no certificate holder responded to an advertisement for the position for which the applicant is being considered;
a rationale for not hiring a certificate holder who responded to an advertisement for the position for which the applicant is being considered;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a declaration by the prospective employer of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the prospective employer has no knowledge of any facts that would make the applicant an inappropriate person to work with children;
the prospective employer is satisfied that the applicant is of good character.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director of certification must specify on the letter of permission the period of time for which the letter of permission is valid.
